Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Trump Plans to Tap Biden’s Green Bank to Make Billions in Loans

content: Jamie Dimon, the head of JPMorgan, says his retirement is “several years away." Sonali Basak and Matt Miller talk about Dimon's retirement timeline and why the big bank CEO is sticking around. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Boeing Upgraded to Buy at Bank of America as Trump Favors Planemaker for Trade Talks
content: The Trump administration has been including orders for Boeing Co. planes in trade discussions, and that’s helping to restore Bank of America Corp.’s confidence in the stock.

title: The US Economy Has a Leak
content: Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.

title: Treasuries Fall as Tariff Concerns Cloud Outlook, ISM Weaker
content: Treasuries remained lower amid broad weakness in US assets on Monday, as worries over President Donald Trump’s tariff policy swirl at the start of a busy week for data on the health of the world’s largest economy.

title: Wall Street Sees Deeper Rout as Dollar Nears 2023 Low
content: Wall Street banks are reinforcing their calls that the dollar will weaken further, hit by interest-rate cuts, slowing economic growth and President Donald Trump’s trade and tax policies.

title: Alberta Wildfires Shut Down About 7% of Canada’s Oil Production
content: Wildfires in Canada’s energy heartland of Alberta have shut down almost 350,000 barrels of daily heavy crude production — about 7% of the country’s output — as a major blaze near the province’s eastern border menaces oil sands operations.

title: US Stocks Slip as Trade Friction, Weak Data Dent Sentiment
content: US equities edged lower Monday as reemerging tensions around global trade and a weak manufacturing report sapped investor confidence.

title: The Ratings Underdog Making Waves in Private Credit
content: Egan-Jones is a small but significant player in the private credit market,  grading over three thousand investments last year with a team of just 20 analysts. The firm's fast growth and optimistic ratings, however, are raising concerns about the risks in the private credit market, with some major investors excluding them from their lists of acceptable credit graders. Bloomberg Private Credit Reporter Silas Brown joined Wall Street Beat on Bloomberg Open Interest with the details. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Gold Surges With Rising Global Tensions Boosting Haven Demand
content: Gold surged on revived demand for safer assets as the US and China traded accusations, while a dramatic series of attacks clouded the prospects of peace between Russia and Ukraine.

title: Bloomberg Surveillance 6/2/2025
content: Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern speak daily with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond. No other program better positions investors and executives for the trading day. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Diamond Wars: The Future of Lab Grown vs. Natural Diamonds
content: Lab Grown diamonds continue to put pressure on the $370 billion dollar global jewelry market. For the first time ever, more than half of engagement rings are made with lab grown diamonds. Despite the boom, De Beers says it will be closing its lab-grown diamond jewelry brand Lightbox. Ankur Daga, the Co-Founder and CEO of Angara, an online jeweler. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Some Retailers Can Get Away With Raising Prices, Widlitz Says
content: Stacey Widlitz, SW Retail Advisors president, says many consumers are still willing to pay higher prices, despite tariffs. She says many brands are getting away with raising prices if their products are in demand. She is on "Bloomberg Surveillance" talking about the impact of tariffs on retailers and says there could be fewer deals for customers in the electronic and footwear space. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: German Banks Pay Millions to Settle Claims by Insolvent Signa
content: Helaba and other German lenders have paid millions of euros in recent weeks to settle claims by the administrator of former real estate tycoon Rene Benko’s Signa Prime Selection AG.

title: Mali Court Postpones Ruling on Barrick Gold Mine to June 5
content: A Malian court has for the third time postponed a ruling on whether Barrick Gold Corp.’s Loulo-Gounkoto mine should be placed under state administration.

title: Eramet Drops as Gabon Aims to End Manganese Ore Exports
content: Eramet SA shares fell as much as 5.7% after Gabon decided to ban the export of manganese ore from 2029, jeopardizing the French miner’s biggest source of profit.

title: Trump Wants to Sell 1 Million Barrel Reserve of Diesel Fuel
content: The Trump administration wants to put a 1 million barrel cache of diesel fuel on the market, saying the reserve meant to provide an emergency supply of home heating oil for the Northeast has never been used for its intended purpose.

title: Saylor’s Bitcoin Copycats Fall Behind as Speculative Pop Fizzles
content: Turns out, buying Bitcoin to boost your share price might not be the corporate panacea that it once seemed.

title: US Manufacturing Contracts for a Third Month
content: The Institute for Supply Management’s manufacturing index edged down 0.2 point last month to 48.5. The ISM’s import measure dropped 7.2 points, one of the largest monthly slides on record, to 39.9. Mike McKee reports on “Bloomberg Open Interest.” (Corrects to show third month of contraction)

title: Circle, Backers Seek $896 Million After Boosting IPO Size
content: Circle Internet Group Inc. and its shareholders have increased the size and price of the company’s initial public offering, suggesting strong investor demand for the stock.

title: Oil Advances as OPEC+ Supply Boost Vies With Geopolitical Risk
content: Oil surged after OPEC+ increased production less than some had feared and geopolitical concerns flared in Ukraine and Iran.

title: US Aluminum and Steel Prices Surge as Trump Doubles Tariffs
content: Futures tracking aluminum and steel prices in the US surged after President Donald Trump said he will double tariffs on the metals this week.

title: Bristol-Myers to Pay $11 Billion to License Cancer Drug
content: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. will pay BioNTech SE as much as $11.1 billion to license a next-generation cancer drug, as competition intensifies in an area of oncology that seeks to harness the immune system to attack tumors. Bloomberg's Damian Garde reports.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Can Starz Break into Hollywood's Big League?
content: Starz is fresh off its separation from Lionsgate and it's betting it can take on the likes of Netflix and HBO. The entertainment company added 530,000 streaming customers in the fourth quarter. STARZ President and CEO Jeffrey Hirsch joined Bloomberg Open Interest to talk about how he plans on transforming the company into a production powerhouse. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Quant Hedge Fund CFM Eyes Canada Expansion With Toronto Office
content: French quantitative hedge fund Capital Fund Management SA opened an office in Toronto to attract wealthy investors in Canada.

title: Matthei Gives Chile Vote Pledges a Reality Check on Fiscal Woes
content: Faced with an electoral campaign fought on two fronts — against the left and the hard right — Chile’s presidential front-runner Evelyn Matthei is trying to mark a difference not through sweeping promises, but by recognizing the cold, hard facts of a weak economy.

title: Revved-Up Polish Assets Dip as Election Erodes Pro-EU Tilt
content: Polish stocks and bonds — among the world’s stand-out performers of 2025 — dipped after a nationalist unexpectedly won the presidential election, dealing a blow to the government.

title: Suspect in Colorado Attack Criminally Charged by US Prosecutors
content: The man arrested over an attack at an event in support of Israeli hostages in Gaza that left at least eight injured was criminally charged by US prosecutors in Colorado.

title: From AI to Nukes: Here’s What’s in the UK’s Big Defense Overhaul
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s government outlined a new defense strategy on Monday that aims to put a “stronger, more lethal” North Atlantic Treaty Organization at the forefront of British defense plans as the country boosts its nuclear deterrent, rebuilds munitions and weapons stockpiles and invests billions of pounds into technologically-advanced warfare methods.

title: Trump Plans to Tap Biden’s Green Bank to Make Billions in Loans
content: The Trump administration plans to use a $400 billion green bank the president once sought to kill to finance billions of dollars in loans for nuclear reactors, geothermal power and critical minerals, according to details of the administration’s fiscal year 2026 budget request.

title: Trump Condemns Boulder Attack, Blames Lax Immigration Policies
content: President Donald Trump condemned an attack in Boulder, Colorado that targeted a march in support of Israeli hostages held by Hamas and said he would work to remove the suspect in the attack from the US.

title: Starmer Seeks Nuclear Build-Up in Sweeping UK Military Revamp
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer backed a sweeping overhaul of the British military yet refused to commit to the full extent of spending increases that experts said is necessary to protect the UK from growing global threats.

title: Mexico Judicial Election Sees 13% Turnout in Historic Vote
content: The future of Mexico’s judiciary was decided by a small minority of voters after an unprecedented election of federal judges, including all members of the nation’s top court.

title: EU Votes to Curb China’s Access to Medical Device Procurement
content: The European Union agreed overwhelmingly to curb Chinese medical device manufacturers’ access to public procurement contracts in the bloc, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Russia and Ukraine Agree on New Prisoner Swap But Fail to Reach Truce
content: Russia and Ukraine wrapped up a second round of talks in Istanbul that failed to bring the two sides closer to ending the war, but laid the groundwork for a new exchange of prisoners.

title: Ukraine’s Brazen Drone Strike on Nuclear Bombers Alarms Moscow
content: Ukraine’s drone strike deep inside Russian territory left Kremlin officials angry and alarmed over the sudden vulnerability of a nuclear-capable air fleet far from the battlefield, according to people close to senior officials in Moscow.

title: Trump Team Pushes for Xi Call as Trade Tensions Simmer
content: US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping are likely to speak this week, according to a Trump administration official, as the world’s two largest economies remain locked in trade turmoil.

title: Trump Wants to Sell 1 Million Barrel Reserve of Diesel Fuel
content: The Trump administration wants to put a 1 million barrel cache of diesel fuel on the market, saying the reserve meant to provide an emergency supply of home heating oil for the Northeast has never been used for its intended purpose.

title: US Aluminum and Steel Prices Surge as Trump Doubles Tariffs
content: Futures tracking aluminum and steel prices in the US surged after President Donald Trump said he will double tariffs on the metals this week.

title: Supreme Court Leaves Intact ‘Assault Weapons’ Bans for Now
content: A divided US Supreme Court declined to consider a new expansion of constitutional gun rights, turning away challenges to a Maryland ban on so-called assault weapons and a Rhode Island prohibition on high-capacity magazines.

title: Matthei Gives Chile Vote Pledges a Reality Check on Fiscal Woes
content: Faced with an electoral campaign fought on two fronts — against the left and the hard right — Chile’s presidential front-runner Evelyn Matthei is trying to mark a difference not through sweeping promises, but by recognizing the cold, hard facts of a weak economy.

title: Revved-Up Polish Assets Dip as Election Erodes Pro-EU Tilt
content: Polish stocks and bonds — among the world’s stand-out performers of 2025 — dipped after a nationalist unexpectedly won the presidential election, dealing a blow to the government.

title: EU Warns It Could Accelerate Retaliatory Tariffs Over US Duties
content: The European Union is preparing for another round of trade talks with the US and warned that it may speed up retaliatory measures if President Donald Trump follows through on his tariff threats, the latest of which includes a 50% levy on steel and aluminum imports.

title: Russia and Ukraine Conclude Talks After Kyiv Hits Bombers
content: Russia and Ukraine wrapped up their latest direct peace talks in Istanbul a day after Kyiv staged one of its boldest aerial attacks inside Russia, destroying long-range bombers and other aircraft.

title: Philippines Aims to Cut Reliance on Vietnam for Rice
content: The Philippines, the world’s top rice importer, plans to look beyond its dominant supplier, Vietnam, to ensure steady supplies and competitive prices at home.

title: Nationalist Wins Poland’s Presidency in Setback for EU Ties
content: A nationalist candidate backed by Donald Trump won Poland’s presidential election, defeating the centrist mayor of Warsaw and complicating efforts to shift the nation back into the European Union mainstream.

title: Ukraine Building Drone Hunters as Fight Moves Far Beyond Front
content: A battle is shaping up in the skies over Ukraine and Russia, as the ingenuity of drone engineers on both sides opens up new opportunities and threats far behind the front lines.

title: MAGA-Backed Win in Poland Sends Europe a Warning
content: The revenge of “places that don’t matter” is increasingly palpable from Portugal to Poland.

title: Emirates Reviews Russia Flights as Ukraine Expands Drone Use
content: The world’s largest long-haul carrier plans to review flights to Russia following Ukrainian drone attacks deep inside the country over the weekend.

title: Polish Boxer-Turned-President Set for Showdown With Government
content: Karol Nawrocki has made a career out of fighting. An amateur boxing champion and self-confessed football hooligan, the historian-turned-politician has written books on anti-communist groups and organized crime.

title: Reeves Says Tories Cost UK Taxpayer £1.4 Billion in Failed Covid Contracts
content: Deficient pandemic-era contracts for protective equipment cost the British taxpayer £1.4 billion ($1.9 billion), the UK’s Labour government said on Monday, blaming the former Conservative administration for “reckless handling” of public money.

title: Amazon Hit by German Warning Over Price Controls on Marketplace
content: Amazon.com Inc. was warned by Germany’s antitrust watchdog that price controls for retailers on its marketplace are likely to violate national and European Union laws.

title: Romania Injects More Funds to Banks as Market Shortage Narrows
content: Romania’s central bank injected liquidity into domestic banks for a second week as it sought to further calm money markets after increased volatility during recent political turmoil.

title: MAGA Triumphs in Poland’s Presidential Election
content: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Senate Begins Putting Its Stamp on Giant Trump Tax, Debt Limit Bill
content: Significant changes are in store for President Donald Trump’s signature $3.9 trillion tax-cut bill as the Senate begins closed-door talks this week on legislation that squeaked through the House by a single vote.

title: Trump Plans to Offload National Park Sites, But States Don’t Want Them
content: The White House wants to trim the National Park Service budget by transferring some parks to state and tribal management. States say their resources are already tight.

title: Bolsonaro’s Plan to Stage a Trumpian Comeback Might Save Lula’s Presidency
content: Jair Bolsonaro’s insistence he can pull off a Donald Trump-like comeback in Brazil’s looming election has paralyzed his fervent right-wing movement, effectively blocking the search for a successor to the ineligible former president.

title: Tesla Sales Plunge to an Almost Three-Year Low in France
content: Tesla Inc.’s new-vehicle registrations fell further in France, undercutting Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk’s assertion last month that the carmaker has recovered from its early-year sales slump. Bloomberg's Craig Trudell reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Allegra Stratton: Starmer’s Need For Speed
content: If you’ve never been to the shipyard in Barrow-in-Furness, just south of the Lake District, then it’s worth a trip. I have been a fair bit both as a day tripper and also as a TV reporter, when I always found the local ‘Spoons stuffed with submariners having a pint before heading off on what they call their “Silent Service” through the planet’s seas.

title: Russia and Ukraine Talks Fall Short of Truce Deal
content: Get caught up.

content: The Trump administration has been including orders for Boeing Co. planes in trade discussions, and that’s helping to restore Bank of America Corp.’s confidence in the stock.

content: Poland's new pro-Trump president Karol Nawrocki is set for a showdown with the country's government. Oliver Crook explains. (Source: Bloomberg)

content: Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Lorie Logan said the US central bank can remain patient as it assesses risks to both inflation and unemployment.

title: Zelenskiy Comments on Russia Drone Strikes, Peace Talks
content: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy speaks in Vilnius, Lithuania, about Sunday’s drone strikes deep in Russian territory which damaged a significant portion of the Kremlin’s strategic bomber fleet. He also comments on the second round of peace talks with Russia which have taken place in Istanbul.

title: China’s Coal Industry Has a Big, Dirty Secret
content: Largely unnoticed, an obscure corner of the trade has reached gargantuan proportions.

title: Space, Defense Firm Voyager Seeks to Raise $319 Million in IPO
content: Voyager Technologies Inc. is seeking to raise as much as $319 million in an initial public offering, as it looks to capitalize on rising government spending on advanced defense technologies and space exploration.

title: Russia and Ukraine Restart Talks, Colorado Attack, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 5:26

title: Bloomberg Surveillance TV: June 2, 2025 (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 27:29

title: HF Foods’ Lin on Organic Growth Strategies, M&A: Choppin’ It Up
content: M&A is a great opportunity for HF Foods Group because Asian specialty foodservice distribution is primarily made up of smaller competitors and HF is the only national player in the US, CEO and President Felix Lin tells Bloomberg Intelligence. In this episode of the Choppin’ It Up podcast, Lin sits down with BI’s senior restaurant and foodservice analyst Michael Halen to discuss the company’s plans to grow organically and via acquisitions. He also comments on the new e-commerce platform, comp

title: Scorching Summer Threatens Grids and Crops Across Three Continents
content: North America, Asia and Europe will likely be pummeled by record heat and other weather extremes, including a potentially active hurricane season.

title: Kyiv Hits Bombers Ahead of Talks, Attack at Colorado Event, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 5:38

title: The OPEC+ Production Boost May Have a Bigger Bark Than Bite
content: The real increase in output will likely be smaller than the headline figure, with perhaps only half reaching the market.

title: Campbell’s Organic Sales Gain as Consumers Eat In More
content: Campbell’s Co.’s organic sales returned to growth last quarter as penny-pinching consumers opted to eat in more.

title: McKinsey Leans On AI to Make PowerPoints, Draft Proposals
content: McKinsey & Co.’s consultants are increasingly drafting proposals and making PowerPoint slides using the firm’s generative artificial intelligence platform, which has developed enough to take over at least some of the tasks typically performed by junior employees.

title: China’s Rare Earths Grip Gives Xi Leverage in US Trade Duel
content: After the US and China agreed in Geneva to lower tariffs from astronomical heights, tensions are now surging over access to chips and rare earths. And Beijing increasingly appears to have an edge.

title: Ukraine Building Drone Hunters as Fight Moves Far Beyond Front
content: A battle is shaping up in the skies over Ukraine and Russia, as the ingenuity of drone engineers on both sides opens up new opportunities and threats far behind the front lines.

title: Delivery Hero Hit by €329 Million EU Fine for Glovo Cartel
content: Delivery Hero SE agreed to pay a total of €329 million ($376 million) to settle a European Union probe into collusion with Glovo before it sealed a takeover of its Spanish rival.

title: Amazon Hit by German Warning Over Price Controls on Marketplace
content: Amazon.com Inc. was warned by Germany’s antitrust watchdog that price controls for retailers on its marketplace are likely to violate national and European Union laws.

title: India, Russia-Backed Economic Bloc to Begin Free Trade Talks
content: India and the Moscow-backed Eurasian Economic Union will begin trade talks this year, a Russian official said, at a time when the South Asian nation is also pursuing ambitious trade deals with the US and the European Union.

title: Tesla’s Robotaxi Faces Key Month of Testing and Rollout
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ed Ludlow checks in on Elon Musk’s accelerating plans for a Tesla robotaxi service.

title: Andreessen Horowitz in Deal Talks Valuing Abridge AI at $5.3 Billion
content: The startup is raising $300 million for software that takes notes on conversations with doctors and patients.

title: BYD Shares Sink as Carmaker Faces Backlash Over EV Price War
content: BYD Co. shares fell, bringing losses over the past week to more than 17%, on concern that its price cuts are drawing government scrutiny and becoming unsustainable for the Chinese EV industry.

title: Why It's So Hard for Apple to Move Production From China to India
content: Or anywhere else.

title: Odd Lots: Why It’s Hard for Apple to Move Out of China (Podcast)
content: President Trump wants Apple to make iPhones in America. The company itself has talked about — and to some extent already has been — moving more of its production to other countries, like India. But in reality, Apple remains deeply, deeply enmeshed in the Chinese supply chain. In fact, the rise of Apple, and the iPhone specifically, is the ultimate example of the link between the American and Chinese economies. And while this has been fruitful for shareholders all around the world, and contribute

title: Telkom Indonesia Is Said to Weigh Sale of Health-Care Firm AdMedika
content: PT Telekomunikasi Indonesia is considering selling AdMedika and seeking at least $100 million for the health-care firm, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: Atos Gets Offer From French State for Strategic Computing Assets
content: Atos SE said it received an offer from the French state for the group’s advanced computing assets, which values the unit deemed critical to the country’s nuclear industry at €410 million ($467 million).

title: Tom Cruise’s Final ‘Mission Impossible’ Tops China Box Office
content: Tom Cruise’s film is back on top in China. Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning posted the biggest opening for a US film in the country this year, defying trade and geopolitical tensions between Washington and Beijing.

title: Ads Ruined Social Media. Now They’re Coming to AI.
content: Chatbots are pivoting to the ad model and optimizing for eyeballs, just like social media did. Remember how that turned out?

title: Nintendo Has a Shrewd Plan for Selling the Switch 2 in Japan
content: Nintendo Co. is making an unusual move with its Switch 2 distribution in Japan: It’s setting wholesale prices so retailers can earn more from each sale.

title: Southeast Asia Joins Europe’s Calls to Defend Subsea Cables
content: Defense officials from Europe and Southeast Asia called for stronger collaboration to protect the global network of subsea cables as concerns grow over threats to this vital infrastructure.

title: Samsung Nears Wide-Ranging Deal With Perplexity for AI Features
content: Samsung Electronics Co. is nearing a wide-ranging deal to invest in Perplexity AI Inc. and put search technology from the artificial intelligence startup at the forefront of the South Korean company’s devices.

title: Apple Developer Event Will Show It’s Still Far From Being an AI Leader
content: Apple, a year after debuting its AI platform, will do little at WWDC to show it’s catching up to leaders like OpenAI and Google. Also: The latest macOS gets its new California theme; a look at why the company is moving to an iOS 26 and macOS 26 naming system; and details on Apple’s dedicated gaming app.

title: Trump Team Pushes for Xi Call as Trade Tensions Simmer
content: US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping are likely to speak this week, according to a Trump administration official, as the world’s two largest economies remain locked in trade turmoil.

title: German Banks Pay Millions to Settle Claims by Insolvent Signa
content: Helaba and other German lenders have paid millions of euros in recent weeks to settle claims by the administrator of former real estate tycoon Rene Benko’s Signa Prime Selection AG.

title: US Manufacturing Activity Contracted in May for a Third Month
content: US factory activity contracted in May for a third consecutive month and a gauge of imports fell to a 16-year low as firms pulled back in the face of higher tariffs.

title: Matthei Gives Chile Vote Pledges a Reality Check on Fiscal Woes
content: Faced with an electoral campaign fought on two fronts — against the left and the hard right — Chile’s presidential front-runner Evelyn Matthei is trying to mark a difference not through sweeping promises, but by recognizing the cold, hard facts of a weak economy.

title: Chile’s Economic Growth Triples Forecast as Mining Surges
content: Chile’s economy grew more than expected in April as mining output jumped, offsetting a drop in manufacturing and retail, according to the central bank’s main gauge of monthly activity.

title: Philippines Aims to Cut Reliance on Vietnam for Rice
content: The Philippines, the world’s top rice importer, plans to look beyond its dominant supplier, Vietnam, to ensure steady supplies and competitive prices at home.

title: Romania Injects More Funds to Banks as Market Shortage Narrows
content: Romania’s central bank injected liquidity into domestic banks for a second week as it sought to further calm money markets after increased volatility during recent political turmoil.

title: Risks Abound If Trump Ties Tariffs to a Balance-of-Payments Crisis
content: Countries tend to avoid declaring they’re facing balance-of-payments problems, for good reason. They unnerve markets. They remind people of policy failures in places like Argentina, Greece or Thailand. They conjure up images of IMF technocrats flying in to enforce austerity regimes.

title: It’s Not Just Trump Vs Harvard as Global Universities Turn Inward
content: I’m Malcolm Scott, international economics editor in Sydney. Today, Swati Pandey looks at the international student market. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: Chile’s Long Road to CPI Target Sees Peso Bonds Back in Favor
content: Investors are exiting Chilean inflation-linked bonds in favor of instruments denominated in pesos on confidence that CPI is on track to hit the target in early 2026 for the first time in more than five years.

title: Carney Aims to Thwart Trump’s Tariff Assault by Unlocking Internal Trade
content: Prime Minister Mark Carney is pushing to offset the economic pain caused by US President Donald Trump’s tariffs by compelling Canadian provinces to liberalize trade with one another.

title: UK House Prices Post Surprise Increase in May, Nationwide Says
content: UK house prices unexpectedly rose in May, in a sign that demand for housing remains resilient following the expiry of a tax break for buyers, according to one of Britain’s largest mortgage lenders.

title: Putin’s Central Banker Under Fire to Cut Record-High Rates
content: The Bank of Russia’s governor, who was praised for helping save the country’s economy after the invasion of Ukraine, is facing mounting pressure to reverse course on record-high borrowing costs amid worries over their toll on business.

title: Japan to Seek $840 Billion of Inward Foreign Investment by 2030
content: Japan plans to raise its incoming foreign direct investment target to ¥120 trillion ($840 billion) by 2030, aiming to attract more overseas capital to help revitalize struggling regional economies and address labor shortages.

title: Madagascar Courts UAE Investment to Offset US Tariff Threat
content: Madagascar is seeking to boost investments from the United Arab Emirates to spur growth in its tourism and energy sectors, a partnership that’s become more urgent as its faces steep tariffs from the US.

title: Swiss Growth Revised Up on Export Surge Before Trump Tariffs
content: Switzerland’s growth spurt into 2025 was even more pronounced than initially estimated, with the economy expanding at the fastest pace in two years.

title: Swedish Bankruptcy Rate Edges Higher in May Amid Consumer Gloom
content: The number of bankruptcies in Sweden continues to tick higher as the uncertainty surrounding tariffs weighs on consumers’ willingness to spend.

title: Hong Kong’s 2025 Growth Outlook Cut by AMRO on Trade Uncertainty
content: Hong Kong’s growth outlook was cut by a regional organization, which urged the city to diversify its economy and trading partners to counter growing protectionism.

title: ECB Set for Last Easy Rate Cut as Trade Fuels Inflation Discord
content: The European Central Bank is about to lower interest rates for the final time before an increasingly complicated inflation outlook risks bringing internal divisions to the fore.

title: Japan to Set Up Minister-Level Meeting to Address Rice Supplies
content: Japan will set up a minister-level meeting as early as this week to address the supply of rice, Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said in parliament on Monday, as the government seeks to stabilize the price of the nation’s staple grain and quell public anger ahead of a summer election.

title: BOK’s Rhee Says US-China Trade Talks Important for Asia
content: Bank of Korea Governor Rhee Chang-yong said the outcome of trade negotiations between the US and China will have an impact on all of Asia’s economies, highlighting their significance beyond the bilateral level.

title: China Accuses US of Violating Trade Deal, Vows Firm Response
content: China accused the US of violating their recent trade deal and vowed to take measures to defend its interests, dimming the prospect of an immediate leadership call that Donald Trump wants to have to further bilateral talks.

title: Japan’s Akazawa Reportedly Mulls Return to US This Week
content: Japan’s top trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa is considering returning to the US for another round of trade negotiations this week as expectations mount for a deal as early as this month.

title: Trade War Hits Asia Factories as Exports, Production Slide
content: Manufacturing activity across several Asian nations weakened in May as US tariffs and trade uncertainty eroded demand.

title: Fed’s Waller Outlines Path to Rate Cuts Later This Year
content: Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said he continues to see a path to interest-rate cuts later this year amid his expectations that tariffs will boost unemployment and temporarily increase inflation.

title: Stephen Roach Now Says It’s Too Early to Declare Hong Kong Over
content: Stephen Roach is revising his declaration that Hong Kong is finished.

title: Japan’s Firms Raised Capital Spending Ahead of US Tariffs
content: Japanese businesses increased capital investment at a faster pace in the first quarter of this year just as the Trump administration touted the coming tariff campaign that kicked off in March.

title: UK Non-Dom Exits Seen Hitting at Least 10%, With More to Come
content: At least 10% of the UK’s wealthy non-dom population have left the country following tighter tax rules introduced by Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s Labour government, according to a new report authored by a former Treasury economist.

title: South Korea’s Election Frontrunner Still Leaves Many Unconvinced
content: Lee Jae-myung is still the frontrunner in South Korea’s presidential race, but what once looked like a landslide victory has turned into a much closer contest.

title: Pro-EU Mayor Takes Slim Lead in Poland Vote, Exit Polls Show
content: The centrist mayor of Warsaw took a slim lead in Poland’s presidential election over a nationalist candidate backed by Donald Trump, giving a boost to the country’s pro-European Union government, exit polls show.

title: Group That Won Trump Trade Ruling Wants Tariffs Halted During Appeal
content: A group of small businesses who won a ruling that most of President Donald Trump’s global tariffs are illegal want them blocked during the administration’s appeal, saying they were suffering immediate harm from economic uncertainty.

title: Marc Maron Quits Podcasting After 16-Year Run, Citing Burnout
content: Marc Maron’s long-running podcast WTF with Marc Maron will air its final episode this fall, the comedian announced Monday, ending a pioneering 16-year run that helped define the podcast medium.

title: Boeing Upgraded to Buy at Bank of America as Trump Favors Planemaker for Trade Talks
content: The Trump administration has been including orders for Boeing Co. planes in trade discussions, and that’s helping to restore Bank of America Corp.’s confidence in the stock.

title: UnitedHealth Investors Back CEO’s $60 Million Pay Package
content: UnitedHealth Group Inc. shareholders approved a pay package for Chief Executive Officer Stephen Hemsley that includes a $60 million stock option award.

title: Alberta Wildfires Shut Down About 7% of Canada’s Oil Production
content: Wildfires in Canada’s energy heartland of Alberta have shut down almost 350,000 barrels of daily heavy crude production — about 7% of the country’s output — as a major blaze near the province’s eastern border menaces oil sands operations.

title: Byron Allen Hires Moelis to Shop $1 Billion in Local TV Stations
content: Producer and host Byron Allen has hired Moelis & Co. to find buyers for 28 local TV stations his company owns, in an effort to reduce debt while taking advantage of potential deregulation in the broadcast business.

title: Daiwa Pauses M&A Hiring as Tariff Uncertainty Chokes Deal Flow
content: Daiwa Securities Group Inc. boss Akihiko Ogino said the Japan brokerage won’t be pushing to add staff working on mergers and acquisitions, providing a downbeat assessment on the impact to dealmaking from US President Donald Trump’s trade policy.

title: Flagship India EV Policy to Be a ‘Non-Starter’ for Global Giants
content: India is rolling out a new flagship electric vehicle policy that aims to lure global automakers into making cars locally. It knows Tesla Inc. may still not bite.

title: Supreme Court Lets Finra Case Proceed in Test of Wall Street’s Self Regulation
content: The US Supreme Court let the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority proceed with disciplinary proceedings against a brokerage accused of stealing from customers in a case testing Wall Street’s longstanding reliance on self-regulatory organizations.

title: Philippines Aims to Cut Reliance on Vietnam for Rice
content: The Philippines, the world’s top rice importer, plans to look beyond its dominant supplier, Vietnam, to ensure steady supplies and competitive prices at home.

title: New World’s Distress Worsens After Delay on Bond Interest
content: Hong Kong developer New World Development Co. is sliding deeper into distress after jolting investors by delaying interest payments on some bonds, marking the latest flashpoint in a years-long crisis in China’s property market.

title: Dimon Says His Retirement From JPMorgan Is ‘Several Years Away’
content: Jamie Dimon said his retirement from the top post at JPMorgan Chase & Co. is “several years away,” but the decision is up to the bank’s directors.

title: Breast Cancer Growth Slowed by 14 Months in New AstraZeneca Drug Study
content: AstraZeneca Plc and Daiichi Sankyo Co.’s Enhertu delayed the advance of a common type of breast cancer by more than a year in a large study, a result that may lead to expanded use of the medicine.

title: Neuralink Rival Paradromics Tests Brain Implant in First Human
content: Paradromics Inc., a brain implant company and rival to Elon Musk’s Neuralink, tested its device in its first human patient last month.

title: Chime, Holders Seek $832 Million in IPO at Reduced Valuation
content: Chime Financial Inc. and some of its shareholders are seeking to raise as much as $832 million from an initial public offering, which could give the San Francisco-based fintech a fully diluted valuation of as much as roughly $11 billion, a significant drop from its peak valuation in 2021.

title: Leela Luxury Hotels Owner’s India IPO Gets Off to a Tepid Start
content: The shares of the operator of the India’s Leela luxury hotels made a lackluster debut in Mumbai after having raised money through India’s second-largest initial public offering this year.

title: Deutsche Bank Hires Veteran HSBC Telecom Banker Bailey
content: Deutsche Bank AG is hiring veteran HSBC Holdings Plc telecom banker Dan Bailey, people with knowledge of the matter said.

title: Tesla Sales Plunge 67% to an Almost Three-Year Low in France
content: Tesla Inc.’s new-vehicle registrations fell further in France, undercutting Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk’s assertion last month that the carmaker has recovered from its early-year sales slump.

title: Monzo Profit Soars as British Challenger Bank Boosts Lending
content: Monzo Bank Ltd. said its profit quadrupled last year with a burgeoning loan book and customer growth lifting revenue, as the mobile bank works toward an eventual stock market debut.

title: PwC Troubles in China Deepen With Exit of Hong Kong Partners
content: PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP troubles are now deepening in Hong Kong as the firm is wrestling with the consequences of its audits of China Evergrande Group.

title: TDB Warns Losses on African Development Banks Set Dangerous Precedent
content: Forcing African development lenders to take losses in sovereign debt restructurings would set a dangerous precedent and increase the cost of financing on the continent, TDB President and Managing Director Admassu Tadesse cautioned.

title: Sanofi to Buy Immunology Biotech Blueprint for $9.1 Billion
content: Sanofi agreed to buy Blueprint Medicines Corp. for at least $9.1 billion as the French drugmaker expands further in rare immunological diseases.

title: BYD Shares Sink as Carmaker Faces Backlash Over EV Price War
content: BYD Co. shares fell, bringing losses over the past week to more than 17%, on concern that its price cuts are drawing government scrutiny and becoming unsustainable for the Chinese EV industry.

title: Why It's So Hard for Apple to Move Production From China to India
content: Or anywhere else.

title: Odd Lots: Why It’s Hard for Apple to Move Out of China (Podcast)
content: President Trump wants Apple to make iPhones in America. The company itself has talked about — and to some extent already has been — moving more of its production to other countries, like India. But in reality, Apple remains deeply, deeply enmeshed in the Chinese supply chain. In fact, the rise of Apple, and the iPhone specifically, is the ultimate example of the link between the American and Chinese economies. And while this has been fruitful for shareholders all around the world, and contribute

title: Telkom Indonesia Is Said to Weigh Sale of Health-Care Firm AdMedika
content: PT Telekomunikasi Indonesia is considering selling AdMedika and seeking at least $100 million for the health-care firm, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: British Airways Owner Sees Transatlantic Slowdown Recovering
content: IAG SA said the weaker demand on transatlantic routes has shown signs of easing over the past three weeks as the travel outlook begins to stabilize following a period of uncertainty.

title: Tom Cruise’s Final ‘Mission Impossible’ Tops China Box Office
content: Tom Cruise’s film is back on top in China. Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning posted the biggest opening for a US film in the country this year, defying trade and geopolitical tensions between Washington and Beijing.

title: Air India CEO Says Pakistan Airspace Ban Adding to Flying Costs
content: The continuing ban for Indian airlines in using Pakistani airspace is adding flying hours for non-stop flights and will weigh down Air India Ltd.’s path to profitability, its top executive said in an interview.

title: Billionaire Guts Media Firm Weeks After Glitzy Dubai Launch
content: Naguib Sawiris set up Moniify for the TikTok generation. But shortly after it went live, the firm abruptly changed course, leaving new staff with nowhere to go.

content: Rheinmetall AG’s surging stock price has earned the tank and munitions maker a place in the euro area’s main stock benchmark.

title: Japan’s Bonds Pass 10-Year Supply Test as 30-Year Sale Looms
content: Stronger demand at Japan’s 10-year bond sale brought some temporary relief as traders position for another auction in less than 48 hours that will test appetite for longer-dated debt.

title: MJ Gleeson Cuts Outlook on Slow UK Recovery, Planning Hurdles
content: MJ Gleeson Plc slashed guidance, citing a slow housing market recovery in the UK and planning delays.

title: Swiss Inflation Turns Negative for First Time in Four Years
content: The inflation rate in Switzerland turned negative for the first time since early 2021, adding to pressure on policymakers to lower borrowing costs later this month.

title: Gold Edges Lower on Stronger Dollar Ahead of US Labor Figures
content: Gold dipped as the dollar strengthened ahead of US labor data later this week that will help steer the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy.

title: China’s Private Factory Gauge Plunges to Weakest Since 2022
content: China’s manufacturing sector had its worst slump since September 2022, according to a private survey, as higher tariffs took a toll on smaller exporters despite a truce in the trade war with the US.

title: UK’s Ofwat Set for Supervisory Role in Regulatory Overhaul
content: The UK water regulator needs to take a more supervisory role akin to the banking sector in order to help stem the industry’s worst crisis in decades.

title: Global Stocks Near Record High Sets Stage for Further Gains
content: Global equities are edging close to an all-time high, with some analysts forecasting further upside supported by dip-buying activity.

title: US Stock Futures Drop, Dollar Gains After Selloff: Markets Wrap
content: US equity-index futures retreated after a rally in the S&P 500 late Monday as investors awaited news on any trade talks between President Donald Trump and China’s Xi Jinping.

title: Tilton: China Very Competitive Gaining Shares vs US
content: The US is extending the tariff pause on some Chinese goods until August 31 as President Donald Trump is expected to speak with Chinese leader, Xi Jinping. Meanwhile the Caixin manufacturing PMI fell to 48.3 last month, experiencing its worst slump since September 2022. Andrew Tilton, Chief APAC Economist at Goldman Sachs spoke to Bloomberg’s Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche on the Chinese economy performance. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Harling: Biggest EM Challenge is Currency Stability
content: Bonds in Australia and Singapore gained as questions about the appeal of US Treasuries sent investors toward top-rated alternatives. But Emerging-market stocks fell to their lowest level since May 9 as fresh trade tensions between the US and China clouded the global outlook. Victoria Harling, Co-Head of Emerging Market Corporate Debt at Ninety One spoke to Bloomberg’s Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche on the mood in emerging markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Qatar-Backed Kasada Targets First North Africa Hotel Deal
content: Kasada Capital Management, a private equity firm backed by Qatar’s $524 billion sovereign wealth fund, expects to strike a hotel deal in Morocco in the first half of 2026, marking its entry into North Africa’s booming hospitality and tourism industry.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 06/03/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 6/3/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Klarna CEO Attracts Sweden’s Elite in Flat Capital Share Sale
content: Flat Capital AB, the investment firm of Klarna co-founder Sebastian Siemiatkowski and his wife Nina Siemiatkowski, has broadened its shareholder base via a rights issue that included some of Sweden’s most prominent business families.

title: Palm Oil Jumps on Demand Prospects After India Cuts Import Duty
content: Palm oil climbed to the highest level in almost three weeks on expectations for higher demand after top buyer India cut import duties.

title: Oil Extends Gains on Weaker Dollar, Geopolitical Uncertainty
content: Oil rose for a second day as a weakener dollar boosted the appeal of commodities priced in the currency and geopolitical ructions limited the chance of more supply from Russia and Iran.

title: Most Adani Stocks Fall on Report of US Probe Into Iran Shipments
content: Most Adani Group units’ shares fell Tuesday following a report by The Wall Street Journal that said US prosecutors are probing the Indian conglomerate’s possible dealings with sanctions-hit Iran.

title: Swedish Steelmaker Alleima Sees Pricing as Counter to US Tariffs
content: The chief executive officer of Swedish steelmaker Alleima AB says the company will not absorb any potential costs from tariffs and will instead focus its efforts on raising prices, as well as targeting specific industries.

title: Iron Ore Falls as China PMI Slips to Lowest Level Since 2022
content: Iron ore and base metals dropped on concerns about China’s economic outlook, as a gauge of the country’s manufacturing activity fell to its lowest level in more than two years.

title: US Dollar Will Go Lower But Not in Disorderly Fashion, Nomura's Koo Says
content: Richard Koo, chief economist at Nomura Research Institute, shares his outlook for the US dollar, trade relations and bond yields. He speaks to Bloomberg's Haslinda Amin at the Nomura Investment Forum Asia in Singapore. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: America's 'Smartest Minds' Will Be Beckoned to Australia: Jagadish
content: The Australian Academy of Science says the country has an unparalleled opportunity to attract talent leaving the United States amid Trump's foreign student visa crackdown. The academy's president, Chennupati Jagadish talks about the opportunities for Australia on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 6/3/25
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Seoul and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: RBA’s Hunter Sees US Tariffs Dragging on Australian Growth, Jobs
content: Australia’s central bank expects global trade uncertainty will weigh on the domestic economy and employment, according to a senior official, helping explain policymakers’ surprise switch to a dovish stance last month.

title: Mongolia’s Main Party to Form New Government After PM Ousted
content: Mongolia’s main political party will form a new government after lawmakers rejected a confidence vote, ousting Prime Minister Oyun-Erdene Luvsannamsrai and exacerbating uncertainty for the nation’s economy as it struggles with China’s weakening demand for raw materials.

title: Lutnick Sees US-India Trade Deal in ‘Not-Too-Distant Future’
content: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said he’s “very optimistic” about prospects for a trade deal between the US and India, suggesting an agreement could come before a July deadline for higher tariffs.

title: Swiss Inflation Turns Negative for First Time in Four Years
content: The inflation rate in Switzerland turned negative for the first time since early 2021, adding to pressure on policymakers to lower borrowing costs later this month.

title: Dutch Parties Hold Emergency Talks to Avoid Government Collapse
content: The ruling coalition in the Netherlands will hold a second day of emergency meetings Tuesday in a bid to avoid a government collapse over the country’s migration policy.

title: UK Threatens to Sue Roman Abramovich Over Chelsea Sale Proceeds
content: The UK government said it may take billionaire Russian businessman Roman Abramovich to court in order to release £2.34 billion ($3.2 billion) from the proceeds of his sale of Chelsea football club for humanitarian purposes in Ukraine.

title: Starmer Torn Between Trump and Labour on UK Defense Overhaul
content: Keir Starmer’s revamp of defense policy intended to show both Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin that Britain is serious about maintaining its role as a key power in Europe and NATO.

title: Trump’s Dealmaking Style Won’t Sway Xi, Ex-White House Aide Says
content: A potential trade deal between the world’s top two economies hinges on Donald Trump and Xi Jinping overcoming core differences in their negotiation styles, former acting White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney said.

title: Israel’s Gaza Attacks Spur European Leaders to Criticize Netanyahu
content: Some of Israel’s most loyal supporters in Europe are increasingly speaking out against the war in Gaza, with several nations, including Germany, considering curbs on trade and arms sales.

title: Trump Says US Won’t Agree to Any Uranium Enrichment by Iran
content: The US won’t allow any uranium enrichment as part of a potential nuclear deal with Iran, President Donald Trump said.

title: South Korea Votes for New Leader to Heal Nation, Spur Growth
content: South Koreans head to the polls Tuesday to elect a new president after an attempt to impose martial law at the end of last year triggered its worst constitutional crisis in decades.

title: How Ukraine’s Drone Arsenal Shocked Russia and Changed Modern Warfare
content: Costing as little as $400 apiece, Kyiv’s flying machines are successfully neutralizing sophisticated Russian equipment worth thousands of times more.

title: UK Eyes Greater Nuclear Role in Europe Amid Doubts About US
content: The UK envisages taking an enhanced role in NATO’s nuclear deterrence amid doubts surrounding the US commitment to the alliance, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer pledges to make Britain “war-ready” to counter Russian aggression in Europe.

title: Nigeria Attacks Surge as Islamic-State Affiliate Hits Army Bases
content: Islamist militants have ramped up an insurgency in northeastern Nigeria and attacked dozens of fortified army bases since the start of the year, setting back President Bola Tinubu’s efforts to restore security in Africa’s most-populous nation.

title: Macron and Meloni Aim to Reconcile as Europe Seeks United Front
content: French President Emmanuel Macron and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni will look to patch up difficult relations during a bilateral meeting in Rome on Tuesday, as Europe grapples with the seismic geopolitical shifts caused by the Trump administration.

title: BOJ’s Ueda Hints at Chance of Continuing to Cut Bond Purchases
content: Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda hinted that the central bank could continue to slow the pace of government bond purchases next fiscal year, as the board’s decision over bond buying approaches.

title: Chinese Firms Warn EU Procurement Curb Could Hurt Trade Ties
content: A Chinese business lobby group warned that EU actions to curb access of the country’s medical device makers to government contracts in the bloc will hurt trade ties.

title: Prabowo Slams Corrupt Indonesian Officials, Warns Foreign NGOs
content: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto used a national holiday address to deliver a sharp warning to the country’s political elite, urging underperforming public officials to step down or face removal.

title: Media Groups Probed by FTC Over Allegedly Coordinating Boycotts
content: The US Federal Trade Commission is investigating whether more than a dozen media and advertising groups have illegally colluded to boycott online content alleged to be hateful, false or misleading, according to people familiar with the matter and a document seen by Bloomberg News.

title: Trump Presses Reluctant GOP Senators to Embrace House Tax Bill
content: President Donald Trump worked the phones Monday and took to social media to try to sway Republican holdouts on his multi-trillion dollar tax bill, encountering conflicting demands from GOP senators even as he urged them to move swiftly.

title: Carney Open to New Canada Oil Pipeline Tied to Carbon Capture
content: Mark Carney said he sees opportunity for Canada to build a new pipeline to ship more oil to foreign markets, if it’s tied to billions in green investments to reduce the industry’s environmental footprint.

title: Doritos, M&Ms Could Be Forced to Include Warning Labels in Texas
content: A Texas bill on the verge of becoming law would require labels on packaged food from Skittles to Mountain Dew that warn about ingredients “not recommended for human consumption” by other countries.

title: Korean Air Chairman Calls for Political Stability, Tariff Cuts
content: South Korea’s next government should prioritize making a trade deal with Washington that shields the aviation industry from tariffs, the head of the country’s largest airline said.

title: Federal Retirement Process Goes Digital, Targeting Paper Pileup
content: The federal personnel agency has launched an online system for processing retirement applications, ending a paper-based method that had remained largely unchanged for decades.

title: For Volatile Trump, Trade Pacts With China, Europe Prove Elusive
content: US President Donald Trump is eager to land more trade deals, but talks with China and Europe continue to languish amid communications breakdowns and fresh tariff threats.

content: Bankers and business leaders are shifting more attention toward the kingdom’s neighbors in the Gulf as it grapples with lower oil prices and weakening finances.

Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Mexico Remittances Plunge as Trump Cracks Down on Migrants
content: Remittances sent to Mexico fell 12% in April from a year prior, registering the largest annual drop in more than a decade as US lawmakers mull taxing the transfers and Donald Trump’s administration toughens its rhetoric against migrants.

title: Senate to Review Trump ‘Revenge’ Tax Worrying Wall Street
content: Senate Republicans will examine the potential impact of a so-called “revenge” tax buried in President Donald Trump’s massive fiscal package before passing the measure, Majority Leader John Thune said Monday.

title: Poland: Tusk Calls for Confidence Vote in His Government
content: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk will seek a vote of confidence to bolster support for his coalition government following last weekend’s presidential election, which saw nationalist Karol Nawrocki defeat the candidate backed by Tusk’s party, potentially jeopardizing the premier’s legislative agenda. Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook reports.

title: Russia, Ukraine Talks Result in Prisoner Swap Agreement
content: Russia and Ukraine held a second round of talks in Istanbul, but failed to reach an agreement to end the war. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said that the delegations agreed on another prisoner swap of 1,000 from each side. Kyiv demanded an unconditional truce, Moscow in turn proposed a ceasefire for two-to-three days along certain parts of the front to allow the evacuation of war dead. Bloomberg’s Greg Sullivan reports.

content: The company behind the Philippines’ top mobile wallet GCash has approved a stock split to increase the number of its common shares amid plans for an initial public offering.

content: Tom Cruise’s film is back on top in China. Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning posted the biggest opening for a US film in the country this year, defying trade and geopolitical tensions between Washington and Beijing.

content: Australia’s financial crimes agency placed curbs on cryptocurrency automatic teller machines as the surging number of kiosks increasingly attract fraudsters and scammers.

content: Elon Musk is selling $5 billion in debt for his artificial intelligence startup, xAI Corp., the latest in a series of fundraising efforts across his business empire as the billionaire pivots away from politics and returns to running his various companies.

title: Paramount’s New Board Members Include Ex-Judge, Attorney
content: Paramount Global, the owner of CBS and MTV, nominated three new members to its board of directors and one stepped down, bringing the total to seven as the media and entertainment company faces a lawsuit from the US president and seeks merger approval.

title: Uber Promotes Company Veteran to COO as CEO Says He’s Not Going ‘Anywhere’
content: Uber Technologies Inc. named longtime executive Andrew Macdonald as its first chief operating officer since 2019, part of an executive shake-up that includes the departure of the company’s top delivery leader.

title: Microsoft Cuts Hundreds More Jobs After Firing 6,000 Last Month
content: Microsoft Corp. cut hundreds more jobs just weeks after its largest layoff in years, underscoring the tech industry’s efforts to trim costs even as it plows billions of dollars into artificial intelligence.

title: Tesla Under Pressure, Big Tech Bolsters S&P 500 | Bloomberg Technology 6/2/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses the latest trade tensions between the US and China and the impact they are having on tech. Plus, Tesla is under pressure as sales fall aggressively in France, and Elon Musk pivots his focus back to the company. And, Big Tech is driving S&P 500 growth again. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Clearlake Overhauls Debt, Gets Fresh Capital for Quest Software
content: A deal to provide Clearlake Capital Group-backed Quest Software Inc. with $350 million of fresh capital to help fund its artificial intelligence and growth plans is coming at the expense of some lenders who will be pushed down the repayment line.

title: Grindr’s Abrupt Return to Office Was ‘Union Busting,’ NLRB Lawyer Tells Judge
content: Grindr Inc. changed its remote-work policy “out of the blue,” demanding employees return to the office in retaliation for a union drive after previously telling them they could keep teleworking, US labor board prosecutors told an agency judge.

title: Shift4 Leadership in Flux as Trump Pulls CEO’s NASA Nomination
content: Taylor Lauber was preparing to start his new job as chief executive officer of Shift4 Payments Inc. soon, as the company’s founder and current CEO got ready to head to Washington to lead NASA under President Donald Trump.

title: OECD Says Reeves ‘Thin Fiscal Buffer’ Poses Risks to UK Economy
content: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will expose the economy to “significant downside risk” if she does not give the government more room to maneuver within her fiscal rules, the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development said.

title: RBA Opts for Quarter-Point Cut to Navigate Uncertain Outlook

content: Bank of England rate-setter Catherine Mann said there’s a tension between cuts to interest rates and efforts to unwind quantitative easing, warning her colleagues that bond sales risk stunting the economy by holding up long-dated yields.

content: Recruit Holdings Co.’s chief executive officer is returning to his role as the head of Indeed.com, six years after he last led the job search site.

title: Harvard Asks Judge for Fast Ruling in US Funding Freeze Case
content: Harvard University lawyers urged a federal judge to rule quickly that the Trump administration’s freeze on about $2.6 billion in federal funding is illegal and that it violated the school’s free speech and regulatory rights.

title: Group That Won Trump Trade Ruling Wants Tariffs Halted During Appeal
content: US states and small businesses that won a ruling that most of President Donald Trump’s global tariffs are illegal want them blocked during the administration’s appeal, saying they’re suffering immediate harm from economic uncertainty around the levies.

title: Neuralink Raises $650 Million in Late-Stage Funding Round
content: Neuralink Corp., Elon Musk’s brain chip company, raised $650 million in a Series E funding round.

title: Cerberus CFO Deirdre O’Connor to Depart, Replaced by Andrew Leitten
content: Cerberus Capital Management’s Chief Financial Officer Deirdre O’Connor has departed the investment management firm, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: EchoStar Bond Woes Grow as Dish Network Interest Payment Skipped
content: EchoStar Corp., the wireless and pay-TV operator controlled by billionaire Charlie Ergen, has decided to skip interest payments on three bonds after a similar act late last week.

title: Alberta Wildfires Shut About 7% of Canada’s Oil Production
content: Wildfires in Canada’s energy heartland of Alberta have shut down almost 350,000 barrels of daily heavy crude production — about 7% of the country’s output — as a major blaze near the province’s eastern border menaces oil sands operations.

title: Nike CEO Finishes C-Suite Makeover With McDonald’s Executive
content: Nike Inc. Chief Executive Officer Elliott Hill named a new head of communications, capping months of ousters, promotions and hirings as he tries to revive growth at the world’s largest sporting brand.

title: Browning West Says CAE Has Chance to Reset With New CEO Bromberg
content: Investment firm Browning West LP says flight simulator company CAE Inc. should be able to double its profit over the next three to four years under the direction of a new chief executive officer.

title: Alaska Air CEO Sees Fare Weakness Lasting Into Third Quarter
content: The head of Alaska Air Group Inc. expects domestic fares to remain weak into the latter half of the year until capacity across the industry comes into closer alignment with travel demand.

title: Newark Airport Flights to Increase After Reopening Runway
content: Flights at Newark airport are set to increase later this month following the completion of construction on one of the busy hub’s runways, the top US aviation safety regulator said.

title: Honda Joins 2028 Los Angeles Olympic Games as Major Partner
content: Honda Motor Co. signed on as a major partner for the 2028 Olympic and Paralympic Games in Los Angeles.
